intro: Piptostigma oyemense, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach a height of up to 1.5 meters. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Piptostigma oyemense is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
